text: (On tap @ CBC 2016 Red Session, Copenhagen) Pours clear medium red with no head, already looks rather like a red wine. Nose is dominated by the fusion of sweet honey, lightly floral, with the notes produced by the red grapes used  mixes of red berries, a touch herbal, light tannin, a little darker berry jam. Very very vinous. Supporting notes of oak and light vanilla. Flavour is matching  like a red dessert wine, sweet honeyed red grapes and added notes of red currant, strawberry, vanilla, oak, light florals, a bit tart to match the sweetness. Sweet aftertaste with a light tannic drying quality. Medium body, flat, a little oily. Bloody lovely grape character here, dangerously drinkable dessert wine alternative!

Red colour, no head. Aroma is red currant, honey, some mild floral notes with red wine notes. Flavour is honey, red berries, toffee, some winelike notes as well as mild wood.

75 cl flip top bottle thanks to Nisse666! Batch 0611. Sampled on March 21, 2017.Clear dark reddish brown color, thick oily residue, but no obvious legs, still very pretty! Red wine, vinous, red currants, black currants, alcohol scent. Sweet, honey, fruity, raisin taste. A tiny hint of butter and tannins, mainly sweet raisin like aftertaste. Smooth thick smooth nice mouthfeel, sweet finish.

Big Bottle from Mikkeller web shop cons 2016-03-21 Göteborg
AR: sweet honey, tart bluberries / red berrymix, 
AP: aged portwine, no head
F: sweet honey, tart berry, warming feeling, wee red wine vinos, semidry, rasinis, lovely biscuits
Bottle @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration, 2016. Clear red body with no head. Honey, red tart berries, sugary, red wine, red grapes. Good.
From tap at CBC 2016. Amber colour without a head. Aroma and flavour of berries, honey, oak, caramel, vanilla and sweetness.

Draught @ CBC 2016 [ Red Session ]. - Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, Oksnehallen Vesterbro, Halmtorvet 11, 1700 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Superstition Aphrodisia Pyment - Cabernet/Pinot Noir/Syrah ].Clear dark red color with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to heavy honey, tart berry, red grapes. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light to moderate acidic with a long duration, tart berry, red grapes, sweet honey. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20160514]
Great three grape combo with sweet honey...no complaints here other than a bit dry as it warms
Tap at CBC 16, red session. Aroma of red grapes, honey and caramel. Sweet and fruity. A good one

Tap @ CBC 16. Pours clear red with no head. Aroma of grapes, sweet red wine, honey, vanilla and slight tannins. The taste is sweet with notes of sweet red wine, honey, vanilla, tannins and adult candy. Awesome!

Draught @ CBC 2016. Pours amber, oily lacings. Aroma of honey, berries, vanilla, dark fruits, oak, wine grapes. Flavor is sweet, honey, berries, wood, oak, vanilla, red wine / grapes, alcohol. Full body, aoily mouthfeel, flat carbonation, sweet finish with warming alcohol. 140516

Aroma and taste is very sweet with honey, caramel, berry fruity notes, nice wine soaked wooden nuances, sweet boozy finish.
CBC. Clear deep red with no head. Aroma is honey, berries, wood, oak and grapes. Flavour is honey, berries, oak, wood, little wine, little red wine, sweet and dark fruit.
Tap @ CBC2016. Pours deep red. Notes of grapes, vinous, honey, light tartness, tannins. Nice!

Poured a ruby red wine color, still. Aroma wasai.ly mead forward, sweet honey, some grape tannins and plums. Flavor upfro t was sweet honey, almost all mead, then completely changed its mond on me and dropped i.to a dry cab variety. Very unique stuff

Bottle from the source. Pours a dark purple red color. Aromas of black cherry, sweet grape, honey, plum. Taste is like a sweet and drinkable wine. Like the Pinot Nior version better (more dry, more oak) but still great.
CBC. Hazy deerp ruby red with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet, honey, dark fruit and wood. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet finish. Oily. 140516
Sample @ CBC16, Copenhagen. Red session. Deep red still pour. Tons of juicy grapes, light vinous, honey, light lingering tartness. Really good stuff!!!

[5/14/16] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Red session. Deep red. Great aroma with honey, berries, oak, a bit of vanilla. Sweet flavor with honey, berries, oak. Velvety mouthfeel. Great stuff.
Sample at CBC 2016. Fruity smell with berries. Very sweet and fruity with red berries and honey. Very nice! Love the fruits and sweetness.
Keg at cbc16.. Deep red. Thin white lacing.. Soft sweet Berries.. Honey fruit nose.. Juicy sweet honey.. Big fruit.. Sweet Berries.. Soft sweet honey
Sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Nice red shade with zero head. Very punchy aroma with some nice fruit flavours. Notes of raspberry, blackberry and red grape in the taste. Very nice stuff.
On tap at CBC 2016 - day 2. Red wine, dark berries and honey. Smooth mouthfeel but too sweet for my taste.
CBC2016. Rötlich pinkes Bier. Geruch nach roten Früchten, Zimt, Honig. Geschmack sehr süß, Honig, rote Beeren, leicht alkoholisch.
Tap @CBC16. Clear red, bubbles. Aroma of wood and sweet berries. Raspberry and black currant. Sweet honey flavour, cant really detect the wood. Has a solid dose of sweet fruit and berries. Nice.

@Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016, REDred. Red winey barreöy nose. Red, black currants, red berries, on nose. Full bodied, slight suhary. Sweet, curranty fine oaky flavour. Light meadowy honey. Excellent.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Red session, Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Clear deep red/purple beer with almost no head. Honey and grape aroma, vinous, fruity, some berries. Honey flavor, berries, vinous, grapes, red grapes, some warming alcohol. Really nice

14.05.2016, tap @ CBC:
No head, nice reddish color. Aroma is slightly fresh, honey, red berries, grass, oak, alcohol, minerals, bark, redwine. Taste is sweet, honey, red berries, caramel, minerals, oak, dark sugar, redwine, alcohol. Medium to longlasting, sweet mouthfeel. Nice.

Tap @ CBC -16. deep red hued. sweet aroma of plums and strawberries. wood and a whiff of alcohol. taste is sweet fruity with strawberry flavors, plums and honey. really nice this one. smooth and little to no alcohol in the flavor.
From tap at CBC 2016. It pours deep ruby. Lovely spicy fresh berries in the aroma. Sweet juicy berries mixed with honey. Wow!

On tap @ CBC 2016. Deep purple body with some pink hues. Taste is red grapes, dark berries, honey and hints of blueberries, lemon zest and vinous rose tones. Taste is sweet honey, red grapes, strawberries, black currants and hints of syrup and mild fruits. Medium body, no carbonation. Wow, very smooth and utterly pleasant pyment from Superstition, well done.

Draught at @Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016. Almost clear deep ruby liquid with minimal pink head. Aroma of red berries, licorice, wood, honey and light sweet alcohol. Taste is heavy sweet with notes of caramel, honey, red berries and wood. Full bodied with minimal carbonation. Ww.
Tap@ CBC 2016. Clear red color, no head. Berries, honey, sweetness, spices. Complex mead. Sweet, but balanced, spicy notes. All goes together.
Draught @ CBC 2016, Copenhagen. Heavy and vinous mead with loads of oak, berries and wood. Interesting stuff.
Bottle thanks to Shad. Pours a dark purple with no head. The aroma is wine, honey. Thick mouth, jammy, vinous, nice sweetness, very nice.
Light purple in color. Massive grape and honey nose. Sweet tasting with a ton of grape character with a touch of oak.

I love the Aphrodisia pyments that Superstition Meadery puts together. while side-by-side the different blends and varietals are clearly noticeable - they are always quite drinkable. colors is deep deep red, smell is complex with red wine notes, and flavor is complex and drinkable blend and not overly sweet or acidic
Pleasant aroma on the nose. I get sweet grapes. Although this is a mead, I get some acidic characteristics that do wonders for the bablance. Im contually blown away by what these guys produce.

Nightcap with ygtbsm94. Thank you, my friend! A grape mead from Superstition...very exciting.

Still, radiant, ruby / rose body. Aromas of honey, red wine, oak, wet wood, rain water. While the aroma is intriguing and complex, the flavor takes it up a notch or two. Delicate sweetness that could never become cloying. Lovely honey character with lush red wine varietals. Elegant and wonderful. Another winner from Superstition.
Smell is honey and grape juice. Taste is the same. Sweet and tannic at the same time. Full body.

Darker purple pour. Holy hell another amazing mead in the Aphrodisia series. Sweet up front and the grapes show themselves subtlety but beautifully. The Pinot noir seems to stand out up front followed by the other two. Not overly sweet but not dry either. Remarkable.
